author: EFE
title: Una ONG denuncia la muerte de 14 personas en una zódiac al sur de Canarias
text:
Al menos catorce personas han muerto ahogadas en una zódiac cuyos ocupantes llevan pidiendo auxilio desde las 14.00 horas de este jueves desde un punto del Atlántico situado a unos 55 kilómetros de Cabo Bojador, en la costa marroquí del Sáhara Occidental, al sur de
[Canarias](/tags/islas-canarias/), porque su barca se desinfla y se hunden.
Es la denuncia que realiza la activista Helena Maleno, fundadora de Caminando Fronteras, ONG que lleva toda la tarde de este jueves en contacto con los náufragos y que ha transmitido su posición a las autoridades españolas y marroquíes para que movilicen medios de rescate. Por la localización del incidente, ha asumido la emergencia Rabat.
Maleno ha facilitado a EFE una foto enviada por los supervivientes que todavía siguen a flote, una imagen nocturna y borrosa en la que se ve a entre seis y siete personas sentadas a horcajadas sobre un flotador de una neumática, doblado y medio deshinchado.
Y también un audio que le ha remitido una de las ocupantes de la patera. En él se escucha a una mujer decir en francés: "Estamos aquí, Helena. Soy una mujer embarazada de nueve meses, estoy en el flotador (de la zódiac). Todos los chicos del medio (de la embarcación) han desaparecido, la gente está desapareciendo, hasta ahora no hemos visto a la Marina".
"Toda la gente está desapareciendo. ¡Por favor ayúdennos, ayúdennos! ¡Estamos aquí, ayúdennos! Estamos sentados así en el flotador (se refiere a la imagen que adjunta con el audio). Es muy peligroso, el agua está entrando", se lamenta la mujer
Helena Maleno ha explicado a EFE que, según la información que han recabado sobre esa neumática, se trata de un grupo de 58 personas que salieron el miércoles desde la costa del Sahara hacia Canarias y que ahora se encuentran al suroeste de Cabo Bojador.
Entre ellos, añade, hay siete mujeres (incluyendo a la embarazada) y dos niños.
La portavoz de Caminando Fronteras denuncia que, hasta el momento, Marruecos no ha hecho llegar ayuda a los ocupantes de esa neumática, ni tampoco Salvamento Marítimo español ha intervenido.
Por eso, expresa su temor a que ocurra lo mismo que el 21 de junio, cuando varias personas murieron al hundirse una zódiac al sur de Gran Canaria después de pasar toda la noche esperando a que llegara una patrullera de Marruecos, porque la emergencia la había asumido el Centro de Coordinación de Salvamento de Rabat.
Y ello, a pesar de que un barco de rescate español había estado a solo una hora de distancia de navegación de ellos, socorriendo a otra patera, cuando ya se conocían sus coordenadas.
Ese suceso dio lugar una denuncia de la Fiscalía de Canarias por presunto delito de omisión del deber de socorro contra los responsables del operativo en España, denuncia que desde este verano instruye un Juzgado de Las Palmas de Gran Canaria, que ha declarado secretas las actuaciones.

author: Eduardo Lezama
title: Ravens y Chiefs abren la campaña en reedición de Final de la AFC - ESPN
text: Kansas City se tomará unos minutos, antes de medirse frente a Baltimore, para celebrar su triunfo en el más reciente Super Bowl KANSAS CITY -- Los [Kansas City Chiefs](/futbol-americano/nfl/equipo/_/nombre/kc/kansas-city-chiefs) dedicarán, este jueves, unos minutos antes de su partido inaugural de la campaña frente a los [Baltimore Ravens](/futbol-americano/nfl/equipo/_/nombre/bal/baltimore-ravens) para celebrar su triunfo en el Super Bowl más reciente. Algunos exjugadores acudirán al Arrowhead Stadium y el dueño del equipo Clark Hunt ayudará a izar el banderín conmemorativo del campeonato más reciente, hasta lo más alto del ala oeste del inmueble. Difícilmente los Ravens disfrutarán el espectáculo. Kansas City los venció en la final de la Conferencia Americana hace apenas siete meses. Ello privó a [Lamar Jackson](https://espndeportes.espn.com/futbol-americano/nfl/jugador/_/id/3916387/lamar-jackson) y compañía de la oportunidad de jugar el encuentro por el título. En vez de ellos, los Chiefs avanzaron para vencer a los [San Francisco 49ers](/futbol-americano/nfl/equipo/_/nombre/sf/san-francisco-49ers). Hilaron su segundo título y lograron el tercero en un periodo de cinco años. La revancha entre los titanes de la Conferencia Americana levantará el telón de la temporada regular de la NFL. “Cualquier partido en el que juegue siento que es una revancha”, afirmó Jackson, quien ganó la temporada anterior su segundo trofeo al Jugador Más Valioso de la NFL. “No importa contra quién juguemos, si lo hemos vencido o si nos venció en los años anteriores. Simplemente quiero ganar”. Pero ante los Chiefs suele perder. El quarterback de los Ravens tiene una foja de 1-4 frente a su contraparte [Patrick Mahomes](https://espndeportes.espn.com/futbol-americano/nfl/jugador/_/id/3139477/patrick-mahomes). Ello incluye la derrota por 17-10 en enero, cuando Kansas City limitó a Baltimore a un gol de campo en los últimos tres cuartos. “No buscamos vencer a nadie en particular, y estoy seguro de que ellos tampoco”, dijo [Rashod Bateman](https://espndeportes.espn.com/futbol-americano/nfl/jugador/_/id/4360939/rashod-bateman), receptor de los Ravens. “Quiero decir, ellos nos derrotaron claramente el año pasado y siento que simplemente vamos a jugar de nuevo al fútbol americano el jueves por la noche”. La inspiración de Baltimore podría ser una revancha ante los Chiefs, un viaje al Super Bowl al final de la campaña o tan sólo silenciar a uno de los públicos más ruidosos de la NFL. En cuanto a los Chiefs, esa motivación está bastante clara: Quieren hacer historia. Ningún equipo ha ganado jamás tres veces consecutivas el Super Bowl. Y hay motivos para pensar que Kansas City puede conseguirlo.

author: Dafne Ashton
title: "Forças Armadas que compram blindados de Israel não defendem nossa soberania", diz Valter Pomar | Brasil 247
text: [HOME](/)> [Entrevistas](/entrevistas) "Forças Armadas que compram blindados de Israel não defendem nossa soberania", diz Valter Pomar Em entrevista à TV 247, o historiador criticou a postura dos militares brasileiros 247 – Em uma análise durante o programa Contramola, transmitido na TV 247, Valter Pomar, historiador e militante de esquerda, criticou duramente a decisão das Forças Armadas brasileiras de adquirir blindados de Israel, país acusado de genocídio contra os palestinos. Segundo Pomar, essa escolha compromete a soberania nacional e reflete a submissão das Forças Armadas a interesses estrangeiros. “Um país que quer ter a autoridade de denunciar Israel como genocida não pode comprar armamentos de lá”, afirmou Pomar, destacando que as relações militares com Israel e Estados Unidos demonstram que "essas Forças Armadas não estão preparadas para defender a nossa soberania nacional". Segundo ele, a compra de blindados de um país que comete atentados terroristas de Estado é não apenas uma incoerência política, mas também um grave risco à segurança nacional, devido à possibilidade de sabotagem tecnológica. A crítica de Pomar também se estendeu ao ministro da Defesa, José Múcio, a quem classificou como um "representante dos interesses dos militares, e não do governo ou do país". Para ele, a presença de Múcio no governo é um desserviço, e sua continuidade à frente da pasta prejudica a implementação de uma política de defesa que seja de fato soberana. "Desde que o governo foi constituído, dissemos que Múcio não deveria ter sido indicado. Ele é um ministro dos militares, não do presidente Lula", enfatizou. Durante a entrevista, Pomar abordou também a política internacional do Brasil, afirmando que é fundamental manter uma posição firme contra governos genocidas e buscar uma integração regional na América Latina que resista às pressões imperialistas. Ele criticou a compra de armamentos estrangeiros e a dependência do Brasil de potências como Estados Unidos e Israel, ressaltando que “é preciso reconstruir a nossa capacidade de produção própria em todos os terrenos estratégicos". Para Pomar, a escolha de Israel como fornecedor de armamentos demonstra que as Forças Armadas brasileiras não estão alinhadas com a defesa dos interesses nacionais, mas sim com a manutenção de relações estreitas com potências estrangeiras, o que ele chamou de "relações carnais". Segundo o historiador, é essencial uma reestruturação profunda das Forças Armadas para que elas realmente defendam a soberania do Brasil e não atuem como “traidores em potencial”. Sua crítica ao ministro Múcio e à postura dos militares brasileiros reflete uma insatisfação mais ampla dentro de setores da esquerda. Pomar concluiu afirmando que o Brasil precisa de uma política de defesa que esteja em consonância com seus princípios de soberania, integridade territorial e respeito aos direitos humanos. Assista: [iBest: 247 é o melhor canal de política do Brasil no voto popular](https://www.brasil247.com/midia/brasil-247-vence-o-premio-ibest-como-melhor-canal-de-politica-do-brasil-no-voto-popular) [Assine o 247](https://www.brasil247.com/apoio),[ apoie por Pix](https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSfJOi0sp8RTiS91kHjo4uzLo97gMTG2ieIk-OOsdv7cvCgFnw/viewform),[ inscreva-se na TV 247](https://www.youtube.com/brasil247), no canal [Cortes 247](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UC_M1ek8fhnDkz5C2zfkTxpg) e assista:

author: @lanacionpy
title: La Nación / Premios Buena Gestión: destacaron trabajo excepcional de linces, policías y militar
text: Este jueves se realizó la entrega del Premio Buena Gestión para servidores públicos de seguridad que realizaron buenas acciones durante este año. Estas distinciones fueron entregadas por un grupo de empresas privadas a cinco profesionales, fue en la sede del Ministerio del Interior en la ciudad de Asunción. Durante el acto se otorgaron obsequios y placas de mención a cinco profesionales, entre ellos agentes del grupo Lince, policías y un militar que brindaron servicios en momentos en el que la urgencia era primordial y estas personas no dudaron en dar una mano. El médico militar Ricardo Vera es uno de estos profesionales. Él presta servicio en el Chaco y al terminar su jornada laboral acude a comunidades indígenas a brindar atención médica. Otros de los premiados fueron los agentes del grupo Lince, Blas Cabrera y Augusto Armoa, quienes se quedaron con el primer y segundo puesto respectivamente, en la premiación para efectivos policiales. Estos se convirtieron en héroes de la pequeña Zoe, niña que padece de un problema cerebral y que es una fiel fans y seguidora de los uniformados. Los agentes, sin dudar acuden con sus uniformes durante cada una de las intervenciones de Zoe para darle su apoyo. [Puede interesarle: Dan de alta a Alexander, el bebé operado de atresia de esófago en el IPS de CDE](https://www.lanacion.com.py/pais/2023/06/06/dan-de-alta-a-alexander-el-bebe-operado-de-atresia-de-esofago-en-el-ips-de-cde/) También fue premiado y se alzó con el tercer lugar el agente Armando Delgadillo, quien en medio de su ardua labor se hace de tiempo para ayudar a la gente más necesitada de su querida ciudad de Luque. Delgadillo organiza ollas populares o meriendas para los niños y niñas del asentamiento donde es presidente de la comisión vecinal. En el departamento de Concepción fue premiada la oficial Emilce Noguera, quien se destacó por amamantar a una bebé que estaba llorando de hambre, pero cuya madre estaba internada tras un accidente de moto. “Todos fueron postulados por la sociedad civil. Fueron premiados por ese trabajo excepcional y no lo hicieron por premios. El Paraguay necesita ejemplo y mostrar a los paraguayos buenos”, dijo Enrique López Arce, en entrevista con La Nación/Nación Media. Lo obsequios fueron entregados por empresas privadas que se unieron para premiar a los heroicos, como cierre del 2023. Estos recibieron dinero en efectivo, vales de supermercados, canastas navideñas, electrodomésticos, almuerzos y cenas en un hotel de 5 estrellas, para que puedan disfrutar con sus familiares. [Puede interesarle: Casos de covid se duplicaron a 500 por semana](https://www.lanacion.com.py/pais/2023/12/28/casos-de-covid-se-duplicaron-a-500-por-semana/)

author: David Plotz, Emily Bazelon, and John Dickerson
title: Donald Trump Is a Disinhibited Fascist
text:
“The Disinhibited Fascist” Edition
Donald Trump might be a fascist…but should we call him out on it?
Listen & Subscribe
Choose your preferred player:
Get Your Slate Plus Podcast
If you can't access your feeds, please contact customer support.
Listen on your computer:
Apple Podcasts will only work on MacOS operating systems since [Catalina](https://support.apple.com/en-us/HT201260). We do not support Android apps on desktop at this time.
Listen on your device:RECOMMENDED
These links will only work if you're on the device you listen to podcasts on.
Set up manually:
Episode Notes
This week, Emily Bazelon, John Dickerson, and David Plotz discuss Donald Trump’s fascism, disinhibition, and age; the state of young men in America with [Rachel Simmons](https://rachelsimmons.com/); and Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion at the University of Michigan with [Nicholas Confessore](https://www.nytimes.com/by/nicholas-confessore) of The New York Times. Join us on December 4 for Political Gabfest Live in Brooklyn! [Tickets are on sale now](https://thebellhouseny.com/event/political-gabfest). And send us your Conundrums at [slate.com/conundrum](https://slate.com/conundrum).
Here are some notes and references from this week’s show:
[Ezra Klein for The New York Times Ezra Klein Show: ][What’s Wrong With Donald Trump?](https://www.nytimes.com/2024/10/22/opinion/donald-trump-ezra-klein-podcast.html); [Peter Baker, Dylan Freedman, Chevaz Clarke, and Aaron Byrd for The New York Times: ][Trump’s Speeches, Increasingly Angry and Rambling, Reignite the Question of Age](https://www.nytimes.com/2024/10/06/us/politics/trump-speeches-age-cognitive-decline.html); and [Michael S. Schmidt: ][As Election Nears, Kelly Warns Trump Would Rule Like a Dictator](https://www.nytimes.com/2024/10/22/us/politics/john-kelly-trump-fitness-character.html)
Jeffrey Goldberg for The Atlantic: [Trump: ‘I Need The Kind Of Generals That Hitler Had’](https://www.theatlantic.com/politics/archive/2024/10/trump-military-generals-hitler/680327/)
ABC News: [Kamala Harris reacts to John Kelly’s remarks that Trump is a ‘fascist’](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=4e9QMw1gqgE) and CNN: [Harris says she believes Trump is a fascist: Part 1 of Kamala Harris’ Town Hall](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=dpuitnymSvk)
[Niall Stanage for The Hill: ][What we know, and what we don’t, about early voting numbers](https://thehill.com/homenews/campaign/4947776-early-voting-2024-election-trends/)
[Odd Girl Out](https://www.amazon.com/Odd-Girl-Out-Culture-Aggression-ebook/dp/B003WJQ7CG/tag=slatmaga-20) by Rachel Simmons and [Girls Leadership](https://girlsleadership.org/)
[Men Without Work: Post-Pandemic Edition](https://www.amazon.com/Men-Without-Work-Post-Pandemic-Threats/dp/1599475979/tag=slatmaga-20) by Nicholas Eberstadt
Richard V. Reeves in Politico Magazine: [Opinion: Democrats’ Problem With Male Voters Isn’t Complicated](https://www.politico.com/news/magazine/2024/10/17/harris-campaign-strategy-men-00184062) and Richard Reeves and Will Secker for American Institute for Boys and Men: [Degrees of Difference: Male College Enrollment and Completion](https://aibm.org/research/male-college-enrollment-and-completion/)
[Nicholas Confessore for The New York Times: ][The University of Michigan Doubled Down on D.E.I. What Went Wrong?](https://www.nytimes.com/2024/10/16/magazine/dei-university-michigan.html) and [Anna Betts: ][What to Know About State Laws That Limit or Ban D.E.I. Efforts at Colleges](https://www.nytimes.com/2024/04/21/us/dei-education-state-laws.html)
Here are this week’s chatters:
John: Niraj Chokshi for The New York Times: [‘No Smoking’ Signs on Planes Can Now Stay On Forever](https://www.nytimes.com/2024/10/22/business/no-smoking-sign-planes-faa.html) and CBS News: [New Zealand airport with 3-minute cap on farewell hugs “surprised how much global interest” there’s been](https://www.cbsnews.com/news/dunedin-airport-hugs-3-minute-limit-new-zealand-surprise-global-interest/)
Emily: Joshua Cohen for The New Yorker: [My Camp](https://www.newyorker.com/magazine/2024/10/21/my-camp-fiction-joshua-cohen) and Clint Smith for The Atlantic: [How Do You Forgive The People Who Killed Your Family?](https://www.theatlantic.com/magazine/archive/2024/11/genocide-rwanda-forgiveness-reconciliation/679948/)
David: Juliet Eilperin, Carolyn Van Houten, and Alice Li for The Washington Post: [What to Do About One of America’s Last Wild Places](https://www.washingtonpost.com/climate-environment/interactive/2024/arctic-national-wildlife-refuge-oil/)
Listener chatter from Aaron in Portland, Oregon: Clare Watson for Science Alert: [Swiss Startup Connects 16 Human Mini-Brains to Create Low Energy ‘Biocomputer’](https://www.sciencealert.com/swiss-startup-connects-16-human-mini-brains-to-create-low-energy-biocomputer)
For this week’s Slate Plus bonus episode, Emily, John, and David talk about Elon Musk following Donald Trump.
In the latest [Gabfest Reads](https://slate.com/podcasts/gabfestreads/2024/10/books-surviving-the-election-cycle-meditation-screaming-2024-10-percent-happier-author-interview-dan-harris), John talks with Dan Harris about his book, [10% Happier 10th Anniversary Edition: How I Tamed the Voice in My Head, Reduced Stress Without Losing My Edge, and Found Self-Help That Actually Works – A True Story](https://www.amazon.com/10-Happier-Revised-Self-Help-Works-ebook/dp/B07R4NMHJ2/tag=slatmaga-20).
Email your chatters, questions, and comments to [gabfest@slate.com](mailto:gabfest@slate.com). (Messages may be referenced by name unless the writer stipulates otherwise.)
Podcast production by Cheyna Roth
Research by Julie Huygen

Or visit [slate.com/gabfestplus](https://slate.com/podcast-plus?utm_medium=link&utm_campaign=plus_pod&utm_content=Gabfest&utm_source=episode_summary) to get access wherever you listen.

author: Getnews
title: Kristin Leest Debuts New Natural Pet Supplement Line, Focused
text: Kristin Leest Debuts New Natural Pet Supplement Line, Focused on Empowering Pet Parents with Personalized Solutionshttps://www.getnews.info/wp-content/uploads/2024/04/1712240561.png Leest offers a range of natural pet supplements catering to common health challenges, reflecting her dedication to pure and effective nutrition. Kristin Leest, the visionary behind Simply Standard Poodles, LLC, a renowned breeding establishment of American Kennel Club Champion bloodline Standard Poodles based in Charleston, South Carolina, is embarking on an exciting new venture. With her extensive background in dog training and pet nutritional health, Leest is proud to introduce her own brand of natural pet powder supplements, designed to empower pet parents in addressing the escalating challenges in pet health. Recognizing the struggles faced by pet owners, particularly those with particularly those with hip and mobility issues, allergy issues, nervousness, anxiety, and the need for quality nutrition, Leest's new line of supplements offers a straightforward solution. Each product is meticulously crafted to minimize fillers, additives, colors, and dyes, reflecting her commitment to purity and effectiveness. At the core of Leest's expertise is her dedication to breeding and raising standard poodles of exceptional quality. These dogs often go on to serve as support animals, compete in American Kennel Club competitions, or become beloved family companions. Drawing from this wealth of experience, Leest's supplements cater to a diverse range of health needs for dogs and cats. Pet parents can choose from a variety of formulations, each targeting specific health goals such as hip and joint support, calming aid, comprehensive daily support for seniors and puppies, allergy relief, digestive health, immune system enhancement, and more. What sets Leest's approach apart is her commitment to customization. Upon visiting her website, pet owners can complete a complimentary quiz detailing their pet's health history. In response, Pawsitivity, Leest's personalized platform, generates a tailored plan designed specifically for their furry friend. Having navigated the challenges of pet care firsthand, as a devoted pet parent herself, Leest empathizes with the struggles faced by others. The frustration of trying to provide a healthy diet while avoiding harmful fillers and additives is a sentiment she understands intimately. It's this empathy that fueled her mission to develop a line of nutritional supplements that offer bespoke solutions for all pets. The outdated notion of a one-size-fits-all approach to pet nutrition is a sentiment Leest seeks to challenge. She understands that the dietary needs of a highly active hunting dog differ significantly from those of a sedentary older canine. With her supplements, Leest aims to usher in a new era of personalized pet care, where each animal's unique requirements are recognized and catered to. For those seeking to learn more about Leest's innovative line of natural pet supplements, further information is available at https://www.canineparsitivity.com/ [https://www.caninepawsitivity.com/]. About Kristin Leest Kristin Leest stands as a distinguished authority in canine expertise, dedicated to empowering pet owners with knowledge spanning from training techniques to dietary considerations. Through her unwavering commitment to pet health and wellness, she continues to make a profound impact on the lives of pets and their devoted owners alike. Media Contact Company Name: Pawsitivity, LLC Contact Person: Kristin Leest Email: Send Email [http://www.universalpressrelease.com/?pr=kristin-leest-debuts-new-natural-pet-supplement-line-focused-on-empowering-pet-parents-with-personalized-solutions] Phone: 1-843-823-2263 Country: United States Website: https://www.caninepawsitivity.com/ This release was published on openPR. Permanent link to this press release: Copy Please set a link in the press area of your homepage to this press release on openPR. openPR disclaims liability for any content contained in this release. You can edit or delete your press release Kristin Leest Debuts New Natural Pet Supplement Line, Focused on Empowering Pet Parents with Personalized Solutions here News-ID: 3452799 • Views: … More Releases from Getnews [](/news/3452797/unlocking-the-potential-apartment-wharf-explores-the-benefits) Unlocking the Potential: Apartment Wharf Explores the Benefits of HMO Room Let P … In recent years, the concept of House in Multiple Occupation (HMO) room let properties has gained significant traction in the real estate market. This innovative approach to renting out properties offers numerous benefits for both landlords and tenants alike. From maximizing rental income to fostering a sense of community, HMO room let properties present a compelling option in the ever-evolving landscape of property investment and rental accommodation. Understanding HMO Room Let … [](/news/3452796/delhi-metro-train-audio-ads-by-paytunes-raised-the-bar-on-audio) Delhi Metro Train Audio Ads by PayTunes Raised the Bar on Audio Advertising Image: https://www.getnews.info/uploads/521827aae5b16f9aac5891a07274b814.jpg You've probably heard audio advertisements on digital games, audiobooks, music streaming services, and other programmes. However, audio advertisements are now audible while riding the Metro Train. 'Ae Watan Mere Watan' , the newest movie available on Amazon Prime Video, is being promoted by PayTunes Audio Advertising in association with PivotRoots - A Havas Company. Through this cooperation, millions of passengers each day heard the audio ads for the movie on … [](/news/3452794/eternity-inc-unveils-bold-plans-for-2024-ai-blockchain) Eternity Inc Unveils Bold Plans for 2024: AI, Blockchain, and Trading Automation … Eternity Inc., under the astute leadership of CEO Danylo Drygolo, is currently rolling out an ambitious agenda aimed at reshaping the fintech landscape. The focus is sharply on the adoption and integration of cutting-edge technologies such as artificial intelligence (AI), blockchain, and the automation of trading processes. These strategic moves are set to elevate Eternity Inc.'s standing in the global fintech arena, marking it as a frontrunner in technological innovation … [](/news/3452792/allpure-behavioral-health-introduces-suboxone-assisted) Allpure Behavioral Health introduces Suboxone-Assisted Treatment in Florida Allpure Behavioral Health Announces Opening of Suboxone Clinic in Florida Image: https://www.getnews.info/uploads/164421991e3b353c7ad38d8537032568.jpg Allpure Behavioral Health is a leading provider of comprehensive mental health and addiction treatment services. They are pleased to announce the grand opening of its newest Suboxone Clinic in Florida [https://allpurebh.com/suboxone-doctors-suboxone-clinic-florida/virtual-opioid-florida-clinic-online-suboxone-treatment/]. The clinic is designed to provide assistance to people looking to get respite from opioid addiction. Allpure Behavioral Health is known for providing outstanding access to personalized and effective treatment. … More Releases for Leest [](/news/344179/iqpc-announces-5th-international-conference-offshore-wind-power-substations.html) IQPC announces 5th International Conference Offshore Wind Power Substations Taking place in Bremen, Germany, this technical event with special focus on assessing cost-effective solutions to optimize design, construction, installation and operation of offshore substations will give the opportunity to share experience with next generation transformer stations, as well as development optimization for lower costs. The 5th International Conference Offshore Wind Power Substations 2016, produced by IQPC GmbH, will be held at the Swissôtel in Bremen on August 30th – September …

author: NewsBreak Original
title: The warmest December in Hot Spring County history
text: The popular image of an idyllic December is one of white Christmases, hot chocolate retreats, snow-capped conifers, and cozy, cold-weather activities. But not every December lives up to those expectations. Most of the continental U.S. will experience its peak winter cold weather in January and February . Officially, winter doesn't even start until Dec. 21. Across the U.S., the average December temperature from 1901-2000 was right above freezing point, at 32.68 F. Yearly temperatures can be compared to this 20th-century long-term average to find how uncommon a year's December climate was. The nation's warmest December on record was 2021, when the average temperature reached 6.66 F above the long-term average, at 39.34 F. December 2022 was closer to the previous century's average for the U.S. overall, at 33.08 F. The average temperature in Hot Spring County, Arkansas from 1901-2000 was 43.2. The diverse climates of the U.S. mean residents can experience a range of holiday weather without breaking out their passports. Within the continental U.S., Monroe County, Florida, at the Southeast tip of the state, reported the highest average December temperature during the past century at 67.6 F. On the other end of the spectrum was Roseau County, Minnesota, bordering Canada, at 7.2 F. However, across both sides of the extremes, temperatures are warming. While that doesn't mean every December will be warmer than the last or the prior century's average, it does mean long-term temperature averages will continue to inch up the thermometer. When did Hot Spring County, Arkansas experience its warmest December? To find out, Stacker used data from the National Centers for Environmental Information to identify the 15 Decembers with the highest average temperature since 1895. Also included is how that year's temperature compared to the 1901-2000 average. Read on to see if you lived through the warmest December in Hot Spring County, Arkansas history.

author: Liesbeth den Toom
title: Discarded cardboard keeps piling up, so Tesco is turning boxes into rolls of toilet paper
text:
Select your country
UK supermarket
Tesco just introduced a new line of own-brand toilet paper and kitchen towels. Responsibly made not of virgin pulp, but not of run-of-the-paper mill recycled paper, either. Instead, Tesco's German supplier WEPA designed a novel process to manufacture toilet paper and kitchen towels specifically from recycled cardboard.
The eco-friendly line repurposes discarded cardboard from home deliveries and supermarket supplies. These are processed into a pulp that's cleaned and refined to create fibers suitable for turning into truly soft and absorbent products. Launching in 100 Tesco Extra stores in February 2024, the range includes '100% Recycled Brown Kitchen Towel' and 'Luxury Soft 100% Recycled Brown Toilet Tissue Roll' in various pack sizes.
Trend Bite
Unlike that last roll in the bathroom, innovation is endless — even for humble products like toilet paper and kitchen towels. Collaborating with suppliers as they develop ever more advanced manufacturing technologies, brands like Tesco can introduce high-performance products made with less energy and fewer resources.
Featured on the packaging of Tesco's new line are pictograms of boxes transformed into rolls of toilet paper and kitchen towels. By highlighting process and provenance, the supermarket might prompt consumers to reflect on the importance of recycling and on the cardboard waste generated every time they hit 'buy now' and goods are conveniently home-delivered.
Other brands: next time you launch a new product or redesign packaging, could you inject a dose of consumer awareness? How could you help people become more mindful of their consumption and disposal habits?
Join 100,000+ future-focused professionals in 180 countries already receiving our free trend updates.
